H0.text: who has the power ( judicial ) to make decisions in courts of law. Magistrates

H1.text: who has the power ( judicial ) to make decisions in courts of law. Arbitrators

H2.text: who has the power ( judicial ) to make decisions in courts of law. Jurors

H3.text: who has the power ( judicial ) to make decisions in courts of law. judges

A4.text: Judges who derive their authority from a contractual agreement of the parties to a dispute, rather than a governmental body, are called arbitrators.

A5.text: The main factfinder is the jury, and the judge will then finalize sentencing.

A7.text: CCJE European consultative council of judges.
